column4: Look'n for some direction with this error.  Using only CLI.  ifup eth0 returns "ignoring unknown interface eth0=eth0".  I've read online about checking the /etc/network/interfaces file, but i'm not sure what i'm looking for.
You need to add eth0 to the file
can you be any more specific?  perhaps a line that i need to add.
I've added "iface eth0 inet dhcp" and that didn't quite do the trick.
sure thing, I'll just be searching around google.
yeah, I'd like to use dhcp.  keeps things simple.
Substitute eth0 with whatever interface you're trying to add
not quite ;) I had restarted the computer a moment ago to see if it'd help.  it's still com'n back up.
Well, i haven't seen the message again, but i'm still not able to get an ip using dhcp.
I have to go, maybe you're simply using the wrong interface name
Yep.  This was working, and occasionally works on it's own for some reason.  I haven't quite pinpointed the issue.  eth0 is the only card that I have.  and it's the only one that shows in ifconfig.
it's cool.  i'll figure it out eventually.  thanks for the help though.
